dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Uber is setting aside a massive 35 million dollars just to fight this new California law.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Uber is setting aside a massive thirty five million dollars just to fight this new California law.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Instead, Uber says it is prepared to fight any legal challenges in court and has set aside an additional $30 million for a ballot measure to provide workers with other benefits.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Right, and their chief legal counsel, Tony West, made it clear they're not planning to reclassify drivers as employees in January.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Right, and their chief legal counsel, Tony West, made it clear they're not planning to reclassify drivers as employees in January.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Because the company believes its workers will still be classified correctly under the new measure, West said Uber will not be automatically reclassifying drivers to be employees in January, when the measure is likely to take effect.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: They're really sticking to that argument that they're a technology platform, not a transportation company.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: They're really sticking to that argument that they're a technology platform, not a transportation company.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Uber argues its main business is not drivers and rides, but being a technology platform for several different types of digital marketplaces.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Which is, uh, the exact same playbook they used when they first launched and fought all those taxi regulations.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Which is, uh, the exact same playbook they used when they first launched and fought all those taxi regulations.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Ubers defiant stance is a throwback to its earliest days of ride-hailing where it made similar arguments that existing laws around taxis and transportation also didnt apply to its business.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Exactly. It's like a total throwback to their earliest days of just challenging every rule in court.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Exactly. It's like a total throwback to their earliest days of just challenging every rule in court.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: And now they're teaming up with Lyft on this ballot measure, right? Offering some benefits but keeping the contractor status.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And now they're teaming up with Lyft on this ballot measure, right? Offering some benefits but keeping the contractor status.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: As part of its response, Uber is also coordinating with its rival Lyft to propose a new ballot measure that would offer better benefits for their independent contractor workforce, including a base pay rate.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, Lyft put in 30 million too. They tried to push it as a compromise during the bill talks, but it didn't work.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, Lyft put in thirty million too. They tried to push it as a compromise during the bill talks, but it didn't work.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The companies had tried to float it as a compromise during the bill talks, but AB5 passed regardless. Lyft, who also committed $30 million to the ballot measure, said the state had missed an important opportunity when it came to regulating the space.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: So their fallback is basically... take it to the voters if the courts don't go their way.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: So their fallback is basically... take it to the voters if the courts don't go their way.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: We are fully prepared to take this issue to the voters of California to preserve the freedom and access drivers and riders want and need.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: And West said something like, um, "just because the test is hard doesn't mean we can't pass it."
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And West said something like, um, just because the test is hard doesn't mean we can't pass it.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Just because the test is hard, it doesnt mean we will not be able to pass it, West said.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Which is such a confident stance, but also kind of ignores how many lawsuits they've already settled over this exact issue.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Which is such a confident stance, but also kind of ignores how many lawsuits they've already settled over this exact issue.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The company has repeatedly faced court cases, often settling with drivers, but not changing their employment status.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: For sure. And Governor Newsom is still in talks with them, which might explain why their stock went up.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: For sure. And Governor Newsom is still in talks with them, which might explain why their stock went up.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Both Uber and Lyft stock closed in the green on Wednesday on the news that Governor Gavin Newsom, who had already promised to sign the ball, remains in talks with the companies, as first reported by the Wall Street Journal.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: It's a risky move though, betting that cities or drivers won't challenge them directly in court.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: It's a risky move though, betting that cities or drivers won't challenge them directly in court.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: If anyone disagrees with them, including cities, they would have to challenge Uber directly in court.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: But you know they will. This fight is far from over.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: But you know they will. This fight is far from over.
